historical_site.name: Hạ Long Bay
historical_site.address: Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Việt Nam
historical_site.description: Hạ Long Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular tourist destination known for its stunning limestone formations and emerald waters.
historical_site.history: According to legend, Hạ Long Bay was created by a dragon who formed the islands with its tail as it descended into the sea. The bay has been inhabited by various indigenous peoples for thousands of years.
historical_site.activities: Visitors can take a cruise around the bay, kayak or swim in the water, explore the numerous caves and grottos, and visit nearby fishing villages.

information.price: Varies depending on the type of tour or activity
information.policies: No littering or fishing allowed, respect local customs and traditions

historical_site.name: Hội An Ancient Town
historical_site.address: Hội An, Quảng Nam, Việt Nam
historical_site.description: Hội An Ancient Town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a well-preserved example of a Southeast Asian trading port from the 15th to 19th centuries.
historical_site.history: Hội An was an important port town during the Champa Kingdom and later became a major trading center for Chinese, Japanese, and European merchants.
historical_site.activities: Visitors can explore the old town's narrow streets, ancient temples, and traditional architecture, shop for local handicrafts and textiles, and enjoy the local cuisine.

information.price: Varies depending on the activity or attraction
information.operating_hours: Most attractions are open from 8am to 5pm
information.policies: No smoking or littering allowed, respect local customs and traditions
